meanings.definition: To assign a new or different value or meaning to something.
meanings.sent1: She transvalued her old necklace by adding a pendant to it.
meanings.sent2: The artist transvalued the traditional painting into a modern masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: He transvalued his plain t-shirt into a unique piece by tie-dyeing it.
meanings.sent4: The teacher transvalued the student's rough draft into a polished essay.
meanings.sent5: The chef transvalued the simple ingredients into a gourmet dish.

meanings.definition: To reevaluate or reassess the worth or significance of something.
meanings.sent1: After the feedback, she transvalued her initial idea and came up with a better plan.
meanings.sent2: It is important to transvalue your goals regularly to ensure they align with your values.
meanings.sent3: He transvalued his decision to stay home once he heard about the fun party.
meanings.sent4: The company transvalued their marketing strategy after analyzing the latest trends.
meanings.sent5: She transvalued her collection of books and decided to donate some to the library.
